newsitem.title: GREECE: GREECE'S OTE SIGNS $14MLN CONTRACT IN CIS.
newsitem.headline: GREECE'S OTE SIGNS $14MLN CONTRACT IN CIS.

text.p: Greece's telecoms utility OTE signed a contract worth $14 million to build a fibre optic trunk network in Georgia, it said in a statement on Monday.
The contract was signed between OTE, its Hellascom subsidiary specialising in telecoms-related construction projects, and Foptnet, Georgia's licencee for fibre optic telecoms networks, it said.
The turn-key project involves a fibre optics trunk network linking Georgia's major cities. It will be a constituent of Trans Asia-Europe (TAE), the inter-continental fibre optics link.
OTE will set up a network linking the Black Sea port of Poti to Georgia's capital Tbilisi, also extending in two trunks to Azerbaijan and Armenia.
Finance for the project will be provided by OTE in the form of a 10-year loan.
The investment is among the largest ever to be implemented in Georgia's telecoms sector, OTE said. --Angelos Kiosklis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
